name: COPA
summary: Choice of Plausible Alternatives is a focused evaluation of commonsense causal reasoning. 1,000 questions are presented as premises with two possible continuations: either a likely cause or effect of the premise, and the model chooses the more plausible one​:contentReference[oaicite:66]{index=66}. For example: "The man broke his toe. What was the cause? (A) He got a hole in his sock. (B) He dropped a hammer on his foot."
size: 1,000 questions (500 development, 500 test)​:contentReference[oaicite:67]{index=67}; each has 2 answer options (cause or effect).
download: Part of the SuperGLUE benchmark (available via SuperGLUE datasets). Also on HuggingFace `copa`.
notes: Each COPA item is either asking for a cause or an effect (question is like "What was the CAUSE?" or "What happened as a RESULT?"). This was a popular small test for commonsense and was included in SuperGLUE. Human performance is ~100%. The dataset is balanced to avoid superficial cues.
